reviews.text: we stayed here for five nights as part of a three week tour in China/Hong Kong. It was very much the chill out part of our holiday. Overall excellent experience - great rooms though wouldn't pay the additional high supplement for the oceanview (it was far away and largely hidden by the palm trees). Rooms superb as highlighted by other reviewers. We thought breakfast buffet was good with wide variety and quality usually good.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: In evenings we headed down to the Crown Plaza ( about 1.5km away) - a 5-10 RMB taxi fare (too far to walk) where there is wide variety of upmarket chinese restaurants adjacent to the hotel and a good supermarket too - typically we were paying 350-450 RMB for four of us -really good restaurant at back on right (recommended on this site - can't recall name - China horizons or something) . Ate in hotel one night in area where breakfast was served with mains at around 80-120 RMB. Other restaurants in hotel are more expensive.
reviews.title: Very relaxing stay and surprisingly good beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool area and grounds excellent and kept in pristine condition. We spend time on beach - lots of sun beds and shade. Clean water and safe and warm for swimming. No snorkeling locally. Only disappointment was water sports - very expensive and not everything available - no water skiing while hobie cat had broken sail (met manager JP on last day and he was genuinely surprised/disappointed that we had this experience- water sports are franchised out to local provider). Lots of jet skis but at 260 RMB per 10 minutes its not cheap (plus you can only go with a 'coach' to ensure you dont stray to the Chinese naval base at end of the bay!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel providing a welcome rest from touring

reviews.text: Several major hotels front onto the beach -and many more are under construction. My family did enjoy hiring segways for 30 mins on the beach.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great relaxing experience - but lacks polish of Caribbean/Mauritius hotels, but can understand why very popular with well off Chinese.
reviews.title: Very disappointing food

reviews.text: In this most beautiful hotel I had a great stay for four weeks in which I enjoyed the excellent
reviews.title: outstanding management and services + great location

reviews.title: One of the Best Hotels in Sanya

reviews.text: me enjoy each day of my stay. As I have come back since several years at least twice a year to the Hilton Sanya I also could follow the continuous efforts and improvements in services

reviews.text: of the General Management with all its departments. I will certainly keep coming back to the Hilton, which has become in the last years my preferred resort hotel in Asia.

description: Hilton Sanya Resort & Spa is the first Hilton Worldwide Resort in China, features a total of 492 guestrooms, suites and villas. It commands a prime location on 400m of unspoilt beach front at the western of Yalong Bay.
